DeleteUpdate(WaitUntil, String, String, String, RequestContext)

Delete a specific update version.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Operation DeleteUpdate (Azure.WaitUntil waitUntil, string provider, string name, string version, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
Azure.WaitUntil waitUntil

Azure.WaitUntil.Completed if the method should wait to return until the long-running operation has completed on the service; Azure.WaitUntil.Started if it should return after starting the operation. For more information on long-running operations, please see Azure.Core Long-Running Operation samples.
System.String provider

Update provider.
System.String name

Update name.
System.String version

Update version.
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors on the request on a per-call basis.
Returns
Azure.Operation

Remarks

Schema for Response Error:

{
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [Error],
    innererror: {
      code: string,
      message: string,
      errorDetail: string,
      innerError: InnerError
    },
    occurredDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format)
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call DeleteUpdate with required parameters.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new DeviceUpdateClient(endpoint, credential);

Response response = client.DeleteUpdate(WaitUntil.Completed, "<provider>", "<name>", "<version>");
Console.WriteLine(response.Status);
Exceptions
System.ArgumentNullException

provider, name or version is null.
System.ArgumentException

provider, name or version is an empty string, and was expected to be non-empty.

GetFile(String, String, String, String, Nullable<ETag>, RequestContext)

Get a specific update file from the version.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Response GetFile (string provider, string name, string version, string fileId, Azure.ETag? ifNoneMatch = default, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
System.String provider

Update provider.
System.String name

Update name.
System.String version

Update version.
System.String fileId

File identifier.
System.Nullable<Azure.ETag> ifNoneMatch

Defines the If-None-Match condition. The operation will be performed only if the ETag on the server does not match this value.
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors on the request on a per-call basis.
Returns
Azure.Response

Remarks

Schema for Response Body:

{
  fileId: string,
  fileName: string,
  sizeInBytes: number,
  hashes: Dictionary<string, string>,
  mimeType: string,
  scanResult: string,
  scanDetails: string,
  etag: string
}

Schema for Response Error:

{
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [Error],
    innererror: {
      code: string,
      message: string,
      errorDetail: string,
      innerError: InnerError
    },
    occurredDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format)
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call GetFile with required parameters and parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new DeviceUpdateClient(endpoint, credential);

Response response = client.GetFile("<provider>", "<name>", "<version>", "<fileId>");
JsonElement result = JsonDocument.Parse(GetContentFromResponse(response)).RootElement;
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("fileId").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("fileName").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("sizeInBytes").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("hashes").GetProperty("<test>").ToString());

This sample shows how to call GetFile with all parameters, and how to parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new DeviceUpdateClient(endpoint, credential);

Response response = client.GetFile("<provider>", "<name>", "<version>", "<fileId>", null);
JsonElement result = JsonDocument.Parse(GetContentFromResponse(response)).RootElement;
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("fileId").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("fileName").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("sizeInBytes").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("hashes").GetProperty("<test>").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("mimeType").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("scanResult").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("scanDetails").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("etag").ToString());
Exceptions
System.ArgumentNullException

provider, name, version or fileId is null.
System.ArgumentException

provider, name, version or fileId is an empty string, and was expected to be non-empty.

[[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerStepThrough]]

This sample shows how to call GetFileAsync with required parameters and parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new DeviceUpdateClient(endpoint, credential);

Response response = await client.GetFileAsync("<provider>", "<name>", "<version>", "<fileId>");
JsonElement result = JsonDocument.Parse(GetContentFromResponse(response)).RootElement;
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("fileId").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("fileName").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("sizeInBytes").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("hashes").GetProperty("<test>").ToString());

Examples

This sample shows how to call GetFiles with required parameters and parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new DeviceUpdateClient(endpoint, credential);

JsonElement result = JsonDocument.Parse(GetContentFromResponse(response)).RootElement;
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("nextLink").ToString());

GetOperation(String, Nullable<ETag>, RequestContext)

Retrieve operation status.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Response GetOperation (string operationId, Azure.ETag? ifNoneMatch = default, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
System.String operationId

Operation identifier.
System.Nullable<Azure.ETag> ifNoneMatch

Defines the If-None-Match condition. The operation will be performed only if the ETag on the server does not match this value.
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors on the request on a per-call basis.
Returns
Azure.Response

Remarks

Schema for Response Body:

{
  operationId: string,
  status: "Undefined" | "NotStarted" | "Running" | "Succeeded" | "Failed",
  updateId: {
    provider: string,
    name: string,
    version: string
  },
  resourceLocation: string,
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [Error],
    innererror: {
      code: string,
      message: string,
      errorDetail: string,
      innerError: InnerError
    },
    occurredDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format)
  },
  traceId: string,
  lastActionDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format),
  createdDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format),
  etag: string
}

Schema for Response Error:

{
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [Error],
    innererror: {
      code: string,
      message: string,
      errorDetail: string,
      innerError: InnerError
    },
    occurredDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format)
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call GetOperation with required parameters and parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new DeviceUpdateClient(endpoint, credential);

Response response = client.GetOperation("<operationId>");
JsonElement result = JsonDocument.Parse(GetContentFromResponse(response)).RootElement;
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("operationId").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("status").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("lastActionDateTime").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("createdDateTime").ToString());

This sample shows how to call GetOperation with all parameters, and how to parse the result.

var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new DeviceUpdateClient(endpoint, credential);

Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("operationId").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("status").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("provider").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("name").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("version").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("resourceLocation").ToString());

GetOperations(String, Nullable<Int32>, RequestContext)

Get a list of all import update operations. Completed operations are kept for 7 days before auto-deleted. Delete operations are not returned by this API version.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Pageable<BinaryData> GetOperations (string filter = default, int? top = default, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
System.String filter

Restricts the set of operations returned. Only one specific filter is supported: "status eq 'NotStarted' or status eq 'Running'".
System.Nullable<System.Int32> top

Specifies a non-negative integer n that limits the number of items returned from a collection. The service returns the number of available items up to but not greater than the specified value n.
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors on the request on a per-call basis.
Returns
Azure.Pageable<System.BinaryData>

Remarks

Schema for Response Body:

{
  value: [
    {
      operationId: string,
      status: "Undefined" | "NotStarted" | "Running" | "Succeeded" | "Failed",
      updateId: {
        provider: string,
        name: string,
        version: string
      },
      resourceLocation: string,
      error: {
        code: string,
        message: string,
        target: string,
        details: [Error],
        innererror: {
          code: string,
          message: string,
          errorDetail: string,
          innerError: InnerError
        },
        occurredDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format)
      },
      traceId: string,
      lastActionDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format),
      createdDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format),
      etag: string
    }
  ],
  nextLink: string
}

Schema for Response Error:

{
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [Error],
    innererror: {
      code: string,
      message: string,
      errorDetail: string,
      innerError: InnerError
    },
    occurredDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format)
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call GetOperations and parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new DeviceUpdateClient(endpoint, credential);

Response response = client.GetOperations();
JsonElement result = JsonDocument.Parse(GetContentFromResponse(response)).RootElement;
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("operationId").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("status").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("lastActionDateTime").ToString());

GetOperationsAsync(String, Nullable<Int32>, RequestContext)

Get a list of all import update operations. Completed operations are kept for 7 days before auto-deleted. Delete operations are not returned by this API version.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.AsyncPageable<BinaryData> GetOperationsAsync (string filter = default, int? top = default, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
System.String filter

Restricts the set of operations returned. Only one specific filter is supported: "status eq 'NotStarted' or status eq 'Running'".
System.Nullable<System.Int32> top

Specifies a non-negative integer n that limits the number of items returned from a collection. The service returns the number of available items up to but not greater than the specified value n.
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors on the request on a per-call basis.
Returns
Azure.AsyncPageable<System.BinaryData>

Remarks

Schema for Response Body:

{
  value: [
    {
      operationId: string,
      status: "Undefined" | "NotStarted" | "Running" | "Succeeded" | "Failed",
      updateId: {
        provider: string,
        name: string,
        version: string
      },
      resourceLocation: string,
      error: {
        code: string,
        message: string,
        target: string,
        details: [Error],
        innererror: {
          code: string,
          message: string,
          errorDetail: string,
          innerError: InnerError
        },
        occurredDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format)
      },
      traceId: string,
      lastActionDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format),
      createdDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format),
      etag: string
    }
  ],
  nextLink: string
}

Schema for Response Error:

{
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [Error],
    innererror: {
      code: string,
      message: string,
      errorDetail: string,
      innerError: InnerError
    },
    occurredDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format)
  }
}
Examples

Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("operationId").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("status").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("lastActionDateTime").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("createdDateTime").ToString());

GetUpdate(String, String, String, Nullable<ETag>, RequestContext)

Get a specific update version.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Response GetUpdate (string provider, string name, string version, Azure.ETag? ifNoneMatch = default, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
System.String provider

Update provider.
System.String name

Update name.
System.String version

Update version.
System.Nullable<Azure.ETag> ifNoneMatch

Defines the If-None-Match condition. The operation will be performed only if the ETag on the server does not match this value.
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors on the request on a per-call basis.
Returns
Azure.Response

Remarks

Schema for Response Body:

{
  updateId: {
    provider: string,
    name: string,
    version: string
  },
  description: string,
  friendlyName: string,
  isDeployable: boolean,
  updateType: string,
  installedCriteria: string,
  compatibility: [Dictionary<string, string>],
  instructions: {
    steps: [
      {
        type: "Inline" | "Reference",
        description: string,
        handler: string,
        handlerProperties: AnyObject,
        files: [string],
        updateId: UpdateId
      }
    ]
  },
  referencedBy: [UpdateId],
  scanResult: string,
  manifestVersion: string,
  importedDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format),
  createdDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format),
  etag: string
}

Schema for Response Error:

{
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [Error],
    innererror: {
      code: string,
      message: string,
      errorDetail: string,
      innerError: InnerError
    },
    occurredDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format)
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call GetUpdate with required parameters and parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new DeviceUpdateClient(endpoint, credential);

JsonElement result = JsonDocument.Parse(GetContentFromResponse(response)).RootElement;
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("provider").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("name").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("version").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("compatibility").Item[0].GetProperty("<test>").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("manifestVersion").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("importedDateTime").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("createdDateTime").ToString());

    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [Error],
    innererror: {
      code: string,
      message: string,
      errorDetail: string,
      innerError: InnerError
    },
    occurredDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format)
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call GetUpdatesAsync and parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new DeviceUpdateClient(endpoint, credential);

Response response = await client.GetUpdatesAsync();
JsonElement result = JsonDocument.Parse(GetContentFromResponse(response)).RootElement;
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("provider").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("name").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("version").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("compatibility").Item[0].GetProperty("<test>").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("manifestVersion").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("importedDateTime").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("value").Item[0].GetProperty("createdDateTime").ToString());

Get a list of all update versions that match the specified provider and name.

Update name.

ImportUpdate(WaitUntil, String, RequestContent, RequestContext)

Import new update version.

Declaration
public virtual Azure.Operation<BinaryData> ImportUpdate (Azure.WaitUntil waitUntil, string action, Azure.Core.RequestContent content, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
Azure.WaitUntil waitUntil

Azure.WaitUntil.Completed if the method should wait to return until the long-running operation has completed on the service; Azure.WaitUntil.Started if it should return after starting the operation. For more information on long-running operations, please see Azure.Core Long-Running Operation samples.
System.String action

Import update action. Allowed values: "import".
Azure.Core.RequestContent content

The content to send as the body of the request.
Azure.RequestContext context

The request context, which can override default behaviors on the request on a per-call basis.
Returns
Azure.Operation<System.BinaryData>

Remarks

Schema for Request Body:

{
  importManifest: {
    url: string (required),
    sizeInBytes: number (required),
    hashes: Dictionary<string, string> (required)
  } (required),
  friendlyName: string,
  files: [
    {
      filename: string (required),
      url: string (required)
    }
  ]
}

Schema for Response Body:

{
  updateId: {
    provider: string,
    name: string,
    version: string
  },
  description: string,
  friendlyName: string,
  isDeployable: boolean,
  updateType: string,
  installedCriteria: string,
  compatibility: [Dictionary<string, string>],
  instructions: {
    steps: [
      {
        type: "Inline" | "Reference",
        description: string,
        handler: string,
        handlerProperties: AnyObject,
        files: [string],
        updateId: UpdateId
      }
    ]
  },
  referencedBy: [UpdateId],
  scanResult: string,
  manifestVersion: string,
  importedDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format),
  createdDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format),
  etag: string
}

Schema for Response Error:

{
  error: {
    code: string,
    message: string,
    target: string,
    details: [Error],
    innererror: {
      code: string,
      message: string,
      errorDetail: string,
      innerError: InnerError
    },
    occurredDateTime: string (ISO 8601 Format)
  }
}
Examples

This sample shows how to call ImportUpdate with required parameters and request content and parse the result.


var credential = new DefaultAzureCredential();
var endpoint = new Uri("<https://my-account-name.azure.com>");
var client = new DeviceUpdateClient(endpoint, credential);

var data = new[] {
    new {
        importManifest = new {
            url = "<ImportManifestMetadataUrl>",
            sizeInBytes = 1234,
            hashes = new {
                key = "<String>",
            },
        },
        friendlyName = "<ImportUpdateInputItemFriendlyName>",
        files = new[] {
            new {
                filename = "<FileImportMetadataFilename>",
                url = "<FileImportMetadataUrl>",
            }
        },
    }
};

Response response = client.ImportUpdate(WaitUntil.Completed, "<action>", RequestContent.Create(data));
JsonElement result = JsonDocument.Parse(GetContentFromResponse(response)).RootElement;
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("provider").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("name").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("version").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("description").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("friendlyName").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("isDeployable").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("updateType").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("installedCriteria").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("compatibility").Item[0].GetProperty("<test>").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("instructions").GetProperty("steps").Item[0].GetProperty("type").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("instructions").GetProperty("steps").Item[0].GetProperty("description").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("instructions").GetProperty("steps").Item[0].GetProperty("handler").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("instructions").GetProperty("steps").Item[0].GetProperty("handlerProperties").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("instructions").GetProperty("steps").Item[0].GetProperty("files").Item[0].ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("instructions").GetProperty("steps").Item[0].GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("provider").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("instructions").GetProperty("steps").Item[0].GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("name").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("instructions").GetProperty("steps").Item[0].GetProperty("updateId").GetProperty("version").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("referencedBy").Item[0].GetProperty("provider").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("referencedBy").Item[0].GetProperty("name").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("referencedBy").Item[0].GetProperty("version").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("scanResult").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("manifestVersion").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("importedDateTime").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("createdDateTime").ToString());
Console.WriteLine(result.GetProperty("etag").ToString());
Exceptions
System.ArgumentNullException

action or content is null.

ImportUpdateAsync(WaitUntil, String, RequestContent, RequestContext)

Import new update version.

Declaration
[[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerStepThrough]]
public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Azure.Operation<BinaryData>> ImportUpdateAsync (Azure.WaitUntil waitUntil, string action, Azure.Core.RequestContent content, Azure.RequestContext context = default);
Parameters
Azure.WaitUntil waitUntil

Azure.WaitUntil.Completed if the method should wait to return until the long-running operation has completed on the service; Azure.WaitUntil.Started if it should return after starting the operation. For more information on long-running operations, please see Azure.Core Long-Running Operation samples.

Import update action. Allowed values: "import".
Azure.Core.RequestContent content

The content to send as the body of the request.
Azure.RequestContext context

    url: string (required),

  } (required),

    {
      filename: string (required),
      url: string (required)
    }
  ]

    steps: [

        type: "Inline" | "Reference",
        description: string,
        handler: string,
        handlerProperties: AnyObject,
        files: [string],
